artciles.quiztitle: Quiz for Nature of Speech signal

option: Relates the conditions in time domain and frequency domain
Gives the spectrum of the signal
artciles.answer: Relates the conditions in time domain and frequency domain

artciles.description: The most basic property of speech waveforms that is exploited by all speech coders is that they are bandlimited. A finite bandwidth means that it can be time-discretized at a finite rate and reconstructed complexity from its samples.

artciles.q: Spectral flatness measure is the ratio of ______ and ____
artciles.description: Spectral flatness measure is defined as ratio of arithmetic to geometric mean of the samples of the PSD taken at uniform intervals in frequency. Spectral flatness measure is a qualitative measure of the theoretical maximum coding gain that can be obtained by exploiting the nonflat characteristics of speech spectra.

artciles.q: Decimation is a process in which the sampling rate is __________.
artciles.description: In Decimation sampling rate is reduced

artciles.q: For an expanded power series method, the coefficients represent
Which of the following is not a property that is utilized in coder design?
option: Non zero autocorrelation between successive speech signals
Non flat nature of speech signal
Uniform probability distribution of speech amplitude
artciles.answer: Uniform probability distribution of speech amplitude
artciles.description: Speech waveforms have a number of useful properties that can be exploited when designing efficient coders. They are non uniform probability distribution of speech amplitude, non-zero autocorrelation between successive speech samples, the nonflat nature of the speech spectra and quasiperiodicity of voiced speech signals.

artciles.q: Which of the following is not a property of pdf of speech signals?
option: Very high probability of non-zero amplitudes
Significant probability of very high amplitudes
Increasing function of amplitudes between these extremes
artciles.answer: Increasing function of amplitudes between these extremes
artciles.description: There is a non-uniform probability distribution of speech amplitude. The pdf of a speech signal is in general characterized by a very high probability of non-zero amplitudes, a significant probability of very high amplitudes, and a monotonically decreasing function of amplitudes between these extremes.

artciles.q: Auto correlation function measures______ between samples of a speech signal as a function of _______
artciles.description: The autocorrelation function (ACF) gives a quantitative measure of the closeness or similarity between samples of a speech signal as a function of their time separation. In every sample of speech, there is a large component that is easily predicted from the values of the previous samples.

artciles.q: A concept that contains rhythm of speech, stress patterns and intonation is ________.
artciles.description: Prosody is the correct term. It contains three main parts: the rhythm of speech, the stress patterns and the intonation. Intonation is a term used for the rise and fall when a person speaks.

artciles.q: Speech Synthesis method based on the generation of periodic and non-periodic signals is ____________
artciles.description: Formant synthesis is based on the same. It is based on the well known source-filter model whose idea is to generate periodic and non-periodic signals.

artciles.q: A speech synthesis model which tries to model the human speech production mechanisms is _________
artciles.description: Articulative Synthesis tries to model the human speech production mechanisms. It is by far the most complicated speech synthesis method. Its implementation is difficult and therefore is not widely used.

artciles.q: What is the medium to convert text information into spoken sentences?
artciles.description: A speech synthesizer converts text information into spoken sentences. It is used for reading out text information to blind people. This allows people to communicate effectively.

artciles.q: Which of these factors is not required to determine the purpose of speech?
artciles.description: Three main factors are required to determination the purpose of speech. They are: providing information, to make acceptance of ideas and entertainment.

artciles.q: What is the full form of SAMPA?
artciles.description: IPA(International phonetic association) contains some symbols that are complicated and cannot be found in typewriters. SAMPA is an example of alphabets which are compatible with computers and based on ASCII characters.

artciles.q: What is the nature of excitation for silence region
option: Near periodic vibration of vocal folds
artciles.description: During silence region, there is no excitation supplied to the vocal tract and hence no speech output. However, silence is an integral part of speech signal.

artciles.q: Waveform coders has _______ complexity and achieves _______ economy in transmission bit rate.
artciles.description: Waveform coders have minimal complexity. This class of coders achieves only moderate economy in transmission bit rate. They are designed to be source independent and hence code equally well a variety of signals.
